page.title: 02EDUCATION
page.content:
There are two primary (4-11) schools in the D-block, at Aston and at Chipping Warden. {CHIPPING WARDEN}County Primary School has 43 pupils,three fulltime teachers, three classes. Pupils come from Aston-le -Walls,Boddington,Chipping Warden, Edgcote,Woodford Halse. The building is the old R.A.F. Chipping Warden Hospital, with concrete slab construction and long corridors.
{ASTON-LE-WALLS} Primary School has 3 class rooms,3 teachers,63 pupils. The school is R.C.(founded by the Catholic Plowden family who once held the manor), housed in this building 1927, rebuilt 1967. Pupils come from Middleton Cheney, Chacombe, Chipping Warden, Boddington, Byfield Woodford Halse, Eydon, Aston-le-Walls, & Claydon & Wardington in Oxon.
